strategy: draft: You are an ML research agent working on a task.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df[['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']]
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Drop irrelevant columns
X = X.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_df = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_df)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df.index + 1,
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Prepare features and target
X = train_df[['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']]
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X = train_df[features].copy()
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Ensure feature names match
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_df)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X = train_df[features].copy()
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set

test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X = train_df[features].copy()
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Ensure feature names match
X = X[features]
test_df = test_df[features]

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42, n_jobs=-1)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_df)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df.index + 1,
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X = train_df[features].copy()
y = train_df['Survived']

# Fill missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
le_sex = LabelEncoder()
le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

# Handle missing values in test set
test_df['Age'].fillna(test_df['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

test_df['Sex'] = le_sex.transform(test_df['Sex'])
test_df['Embarked'] = le_embarked.transform(test_df['Embarked'])

# Ensure feature names match

test_df = test_df[features]

# Train model

# Predict

# Create submission

})

import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings("ignore")

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select relevant features
features = ['Pclass', 'Sex', 'Age', 'SibSp', 'Parch', 'Fare', 'Embarked']
X = train_df[features].copy()

# Fill missing values

# Encode categorical variables

le_embarked = LabelEncoder()

X['Sex'] = le_sex.fit_transform(X['Sex'])
X['Embarked'] = le_embarked.fit_transform(X['Embarked'])

test_df['Fare'].fillna(test_df['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_df['Embarked'].fillna(test_df['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)
